title: Atos Worldline logo. Is it based on fonts? If so, what is it?
content:
Atos Worldline logo. Is it based on fonts? If so, what is it?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Atos_Worldline_0_5732.png)

Thank you.
author: Robby KKMOZ

comments.content:
I don't know if it's based on a font, more probably a custom logo work. It looks too much modified/customized to me. The only letter that could be original is probably /A. You just need to spot a good Egyptian/geometric slab serif ( [Sommet Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/sommet-slab)... and play with it. My choice would probably be to start with a Sans and add slab serifs, something from [Type-Together](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Type-Together) such as [Soleil](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/soleil), [Karmina Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/karmina-sans) or [Etica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/etica).  
For the rest, as "Worldline" baseline is set in [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015071559/http:/vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag), you could even start with this one.

Yes the Atos is definitely custom and modification on a font or probably combination of up to 4 fonts. But just in case anyone is familiar with them. Yes, what you suggested helped. I'll start with those and thanks for the Stag recommendation, I'd get them too.
